Leaves: Mostly heart-shaped to triangular in outline, weakly lobed, irregularly toothed, up to 15 cm long, with long stalks.
Flowers: Inconspicuous, clustered, whitish to greenish flowerheads.
FruitSeeds: Burrs up to 18 mm long, hairy, with many hooked spines on surface and two equally long, straight beaks at the end.
DistinguishingFeatures: Differs from Bathurst burr (*Xanthium spinosum*) in not having spines on the stem. Is sometimes considered to be part of Noogoora burr (*X. strumarium*).
